availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney. Madison County, Kentucky native. Son of Squire Turner and Elizabeth Turner. Married to Henrietta Robinson Turner on December 31, 1857. Father of Mary E. Turner, Ben Turner, Squire Turner, and Charlie Turner. Attorney in Richmond, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Richmond, p. 252. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 100. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 83. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mt. Sterling, p. 5. "Kentucky Marriages, 1785-1979," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:F4HD-PMF : 4 December 2014), Thomas Turner and Henrietta Robertson, 31 Dec 1857; citing Montgomery,Kentucky, reference ; FHL microfilm 0216835 IT 1. Find A Grave, "Thomas Turner (1821-1900)," Memorial #6868728, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=6868728 (accessed April 23, 2017).
